from vpython import *

# Screen settings
scene = canvas(width=700, height=400)

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity in m/s^2
L = 1.0   # length of the pendulum in meters

# Initial conditions
theta0 = 0.2  # initial angle in radians
omega = sqrt(g/L)  # angular frequency

# Objects
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), size=vector(0.1, 0.01, 0.1), color=color.gray(0.5))
ball = sphere(pos=vector(L*sin(theta0), -L*cos(theta0), 0), radius=0.05, color=color.red)

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    
    ball.pos = vector(L*sin(theta0*cos(omega*scene.time)), -L*cos(theta0*cos(omega*scene.time)), 0)

from vpython import *

# Screen Settings
canvas.width = 700
canvas.height = 400

# Constants
g = 9.81  # acceleration due to gravity
L = 1.0  # length of the pendulum

# Object Setup
ceiling = sphere(pos=vector(0, 0, 0), radius=0.1, color=color.white)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(L, 0, 0), radius=0.05, color=color.red)
string = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.02, color=color.blue)

# Initial Conditions
theta0 = 0.1  # initial angle in radians
omega = sqrt(g/L)  # angular frequency

# Animation Loop
while True:
    rate(100)
    t = 0
    while t < 2*pi*sqrt(L/g):
        theta = theta0 * cos(omega * t)
        ball.pos = vector(L*sin(theta), -L*cos(theta), 0)
        string.axis = ball.pos - ceiling.pos
        t += 0.01
